chargeHist.descr: Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit
Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit

result.execSummary:
The defendant Julie A Scheffler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.203(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution of $480.64 to be paid within the first 3 months to Absolute Necessities Day Spa as a Condition of Probation.

Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent including continued treatment with Celebrate Recovery, that defendant is already involved in.
Provide DNA sample if not already done.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time - STAYED. To be used at Agents discretion. Agent has authority to advise if it will be huber or straight time.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
Calendar of dates for defendant filed by Defense
from Bradley K. filed by Defense
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Julie A Scheffler in court with attorney Joan B Broughton.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1. Penalty enhancer struck by Court upon motion of the State. Court finds defendant guilty. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- 6 months jail straight time STAYED for 2 years Probation
- Court Costs of $278.00 (includes DRGOD) to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Restitution of $480.64 to be paid within 1st 3 months to Absolute Necessities Day Spa as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation:   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent including continued treatment with Celebrate Recovery defendant is already involved in. Maintain full-time employment and/or school. DNA Sample if not yet provided. 
- 45 days jail Condition Time STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion. Agent has the authority to advise if jail is to be with huber or straight time.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 5, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Julie A Scheffler in court with attorney Joan B Broughton.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests another date due to medical issues with the defendant. Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 5, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 20, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Julie A Scheffler in court with attorney Joan B Broughton.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is requesting another date. Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2014 at 10:00 am.
